sen.j: 京極 高盛（きょうごく たかもり、慶安3年8月27日 (旧暦)（1650年9月22日）- 宝永6年2月1日 (旧暦)（1709年3月11日））は、丹後田辺藩の第3代藩主。
sen.e: Takamori KYOGOKU (September 22, 1650 - March 11, 1709) was the third lord of Tanabe Domain of Tango Province.
Takamori KYOGOKU (September 22, 1650 - March 11, 1709) was the third lord of Tanabe Domain of Tango Province.
Takamori KYOGOKU (September 22, 1650 - March 11, 1709) was the third lord of Tanabe Domain of Tango Province.

sen.j: 但馬国豊岡藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the first lord of Toyooka Domain of the Tajima Province.
He was the first lord of Toyooka Domain of the Tajima Province.
He was the first lord of Toyooka Domain of the Tajima Province.
He was the third head of the Kyogoku Family, Domain of Toyooka.
He was the third head of the Kyogoku Family, Domain of Toyooka.
He was the third head of the Kyogoku Family, Domain of Toyooka.

sen.j: 田辺藩第2代藩主・京極高直の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Takanao KYOGOKU, the second lord of Tanabe Domain.
He was the eldest son of Takanao KYOGOKU, the second lord of Tanabe Domain.
He was the eldest son of Takanao KYOGOKU, the second lord of Tanabe Domain.
His mother was a daughter of Tadayoshi MIZUNO.
His mother was a daughter of Tadayoshi MIZUNO.
His mother was a daughter of Tadayoshi MIZUNO.
He had no lawful wife.
He had no lawful wife.
He had no lawful wife.
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was the governor of Ise Province.
He was the governor of Ise Province.
He was the governor of Ise Province.

sen.j: 1650年8月27日、江戸向柳原邸で生まれる。
sen.e: On August 27, 1650, he was born in the Edo-Mukoyanagihara residence.
On September 22, 1650, he was born in the Edo-Mukoyanagihara residence.
On September 22, 1650, he was born in the Edo-Mukoyanagihara residence.
Childhood names was Rokumaru.
Childhood names was Rokumaru.
Childhood names was Rokumaru.

sen.j: 1663年、父の死去により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1663, he succeeded to the family on his father's death.
In 1663, he succeeded to the family on his father's death.
In 1663, he succeeded to the family on his father's death.

sen.j: このとき、弟の京極高門に2000石を分与した。
sen.e: At that time, he allocated 2000 goku crop yield to his younger brother Takakado KYOGOKU.
At that time, he allocated 2000 goku crop yield to his younger brother Takakado KYOGOKU.
At that time, he allocated 2000 goku crop yield to his younger brother Takakado KYOGOKU.

sen.j: 1668年5月3日、田辺藩から豊岡藩に移封される。
sen.e: On May 3, 1668, he was transferred from Tanabe Domain to Toyooka Domain.
On May 3, 1668, he was transferred from Tanabe Domain to Toyooka Domain.
On May 3, 1668, he was transferred from Tanabe Domain to Toyooka Domain.

sen.j: しかしもともと病弱だったため、1667年から養嗣子に迎えていた弟の京極高住に1674年3月18日、家督を譲って隠居した。
sen.e: However, on March 18, 1674, he was retired letting succeed the headship of the family to his younger brother Takasumi KYOGOKU, who was his adopted heir since 1667 because he was physically weak by nature.

However, on March 18, 1674, he was retired letting succeed the headship of the family to his younger brother Takasumi KYOGOKU, who was his adopted heir since 1667 because he was physically weak by nature.

However, on March 18, 1674, he was retired letting succeed the headship of the family to his younger brother Takasumi KYOGOKU, who was his adopted heir since 1667 because he was physically weak by nature.
On February 1, 1709, he passed away at the age of 60.
On March 11, 1709, he passed away at the age of 60.
On March 11, 1709, he passed away at the age of 60.

sen.j: 法号：陽林院殿照山道廓大居士。
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: Yorininden Shozandokaku Daikoji.
Posthumous Buddhist name: Yorininden Shozandokaku Daikoji.
Posthumous Buddhist name: Yorininden Shozandokaku Daikoji.

sen.j: 墓所：東京都文京区向丘の瑞泰寺。
sen.e: Grave: Zuitai-ji Temple, Mukogaoka, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo.
